Comment.Language: Let the sixth priest light the sixth lamp and say the sixth prayer.

Text.Language: Vnou] n~te nip~neuma nem nicwma: P[oic n~te nijom: Vnou] n~te nom] niben: p~ouro n~te niourou t/rou: v/etcwtem e~ouon niben etws e~h~r/i oube tekbo/~yia~.
O God of souls and bodies, Lord of hosts, God of all consolation, King of all kings, who hears all who cry unto You for help;

we Your servants pray and entreat You to remember Your servant (...) in Your great mercy; visit him with Your salvation; take from him all diseases; raise him up from his bed of sickness.

Arih~mot m~mof e~tekekk~l/cia~: eftouj/out cwma nem 'u,/ nem p~neuma.
Bestow him upon Your Church, cleansed in body, soul, and spirit;

Matounocf eyrefjw m~piw~ou qen ]metmairwmi n~te pekmonogen/c n~s/ri: Vai e~takc~marwout nemaf nem Pip~neuma eyouab n~reftanqo ouoh n~o~mooucioc nemak.
raise him up that he may give You glory. Through the love toward mankind of Your only-begotten Son with whom You are blessed together with the Holy Life-giving Spirit, of One Essence with You.
